apex.repper1: Fires magnetically-guided blobs of molten armor material that can repair allies.
apex.repper2: Has a %s cooldown and generates soft flux on use.
has a ## second cooldown and generates....
apex.repper4: Targets the selected ally, if they are in range and can be repaired. If no allied target is selected, targets repairable allies within range.
apex.repper5: Projectiles repair %s/%s/%s/%s armor over %s seconds, depending on the size of the source ship.
apex.repper6: Cannot repair above %s of initial armor strength.
apex.repper7: Multiple repair effects stack with diminishing returns.
apex.repper8: Cannot repair %s without Cryocooled Armor Lattice, as shields are used to cool the molten material.
apex.cmag1: prevents the installation of a full missile suite without compromises
apex.cryoarmor1: Incomaptible with Nanolaminate Plating, Heavy Armor, and other hullmods that provide significant bonuses to armor rating.
apex.cryop1: Fires magnetically-guided blobs of cryogenic coolant that increase flux dissipation.
apex.cryop2: Targets the selected ally, if in range. If no allied target is selected, targets allies with non-zero flux within range.
apex.cryop3: Projectiles increase flux dissipation by %s/%s/%s/%s for %s seconds, depending on the size of the source ship.
apex.cryop4: Hitting an ally with multiple projectiles increases the duration of the buff, with diminishing returns.
apex.exca4: Armor takes less damage as flux level decreases, up to %s less at %s flux.
apex.excc1: Reduces the base timeflow bonus from phasing to %s.
apex.excc2: Reduces phase activation cost and cooldown duration by %s.
apex.excc3: Phase timeflow increases with flux level, up to %s at %s flux.
apex.excb1: The core constantly generates a small amount of %s.
apex.excb7: While phased, expends stored %s to repair %s armor per second.
apex.flare1: Fires guided flares from the ship's nozzles, with a %s cooldown.
apex.flare2: The number of projectiles fired by the system depends on the number of nozzles built into the hull. This hull has %s nozzles, and the system fires %s projectiles per nozzle.
apex.supg1: The current recovery rate bonus is %s.
apex.supg3: To compensate for its wide frame, the ship is equipped with secondary shield nodes that increase shield unfolding rate by %s. The bonus decreases as the shield rotates away from the front of the ship.
apex.supg4: The gantry consumes large amounts of internal space that would otherwise be reserved for nozzle systems, increasing cooldown time by %s if one is installed.
apex.rngsync1: Incompatible with hullmods that provide variable range bonuses.
apex.rngsync2: S-mod Bonus: The maximum range bonus that can be given by this hullmod is increased to %s.
apex.rngsync3: If this hullmod is built in, the maximum range bonus that can be given by this hullmod will be increased to %s.
apex.geo2: Shields take %s less flat damage from projectile hits.
apex.geo3: Shields take %s less flat damage per second from beams.
apex.geo4: The flat reduction occurs before damage type and shield bonuses.
apex.geo5: Each time this prevents damage, the ship's armor takes %s damage equal to %s/%s/%s/%s of the prevented damage.
apex.geo6: The damage reduction decreases proportionally with the ship's armor, becoming ineffective at %s armor.
apex.geo8: Prevents the shield arc from being reduced while the shield is active.
apex.geo9: Incompatible with hardened shields and other shield conversions.
apex.geo10: S-mod Bonus: Shield arc is increased by %s degrees
apex.geo11: If this hullmod is built in, it will increase shield arc by %s degrees
apex.conv1: Only one conversion can be installed at a time.
apex.conv2: Can only be installed on Spectrum- and Backscatter-class carriers.
apex.mis1-5: Geodesic Shield Matrix vastly improves shield performance while armor holds.
apex.mis1-6: Most Collective ships mount a utility remote-support subsystem.
apex.mis3-3: Collective ships are slower and tougher, but will die if isolated.
apex.mis3-4: Mambas have a potent anti-fighter system.
apex.mis4-3: Eidolons excel at punching down and flanking, but cannot survive a Paragon head-on.
apex.mis4-4: Make sure your ships survive long enough to take advantage of repairs from their allies.
apex.mis5-4: Collective phase ships have a shorter phase cooldown and a lower phase timeflow bonus.
apex.mis5-5: Toroid Mortars can be used to intercept missiles in a pinch.
apex.pursuitjets: Increased engine power and weapon damage
